# Chinese Startup LandSpace Challenges SpaceX with Reusable Zhuque-3 Rocket

LandSpace, a Beijing-based startup, is challenging SpaceX's dominance with its reusable Zhuque-3 rocket, inspired by Falcon 9. Despite a 2025 test failure, the company plans a 2026 recovery success and an IPO to fund growth. This reflects China's push to disrupt the global space launch market.

![](https://www.webpronews.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/article-5067-1767058220.jpeg)

**Chinese Startup LandSpace Challenges SpaceX with Reusable Zhuque-3 Rocket**

**Written by**
**Emma Rogers**

Monday, December 29, 2025

#### China’s Rocket Challenger Emerges: LandSpace’s Bid to Disrupt SpaceX’s Dominance

In the high-stakes arena of commercial spaceflight, a Beijing-based startup is positioning itself as a formidable rival to Elon Musk’s SpaceX. LandSpace Technology Corp., often dubbed China’s closest equivalent to the American giant, is accelerating its efforts to capture a slice of the global launch market. Recent developments, in
